title: @Meddler, context on Blade of the Ruined King changes.
body:
As the title says.

Blade got 15 more AD, 5% Lifesteal, lost 15% attack speed and lost the active.

Now the stats are much better all around, but the active loss was a major blow, that may tip this change list to a nerf instead of a buff. Why not give it the Bloodrazor treatment and make the %health damage, max instead of current? Or increase the movement speed slow/haste.

Also any individual changes to ADC kits?

replies.body: Experimental changes testing focusing it more on on-hit builds, including as a first item (hence the shift from AS to AD) and less of a duelist item (hence removal of active damage/self heal to buff other elements). Hasn't got much testing yet though.
how do on-hit builds benefit from less AS and more AD ??

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cxucdBMR,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2017-02-07T23:19:05.228+0000)
>
> how do on-hit builds benefit from less AS and more AD ??

Think of it this way....you wanna go into AP and Mana, but almost everything you get has CDR on it too. Since that has a cap, the stat becomes a gold sink. Same principle applies for attack speed

It is much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much, much harder to cap AS then it is CDR.

No AS item in the game gives you half or even 25% of what it would take to cap your AS.
You'll be stacking AS later on, so more AD scales better with those items.

but not everybody who builds bork builds on-hit.

Aatrox for example

But it's still a bad decision overall for botrk I think.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cxucdBMR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-02-07T22:56:40.153+0000)

> Experimental changes testing focusing it more on on-hit builds, including as a first item (hence the shift from AS to AD) and less of a duelist item (hence removal of active damage/self heal to buff other elements). Hasn't got much testing yet though.

Adding 5 minimum damage to the passive will do literally nothing for on-hit builds, and lowering the attack speed will nerf them. The change made is purely for crit building ADCs (something that is objectively weak right now without a massive AD steroid) and nothing else.

If you want to make it on-hit focused, go all in on it. Make it 40% aspd 40 + 6% max health, and remove the AD. Lower the CD of the active on champion attack, give it 20-30% on-hit leech.

What makes on hit weak right now is that they don't hurt towers. Same thing for crit. Everyone is building lethality because it offers on-item multiplicative scaling to all targets, including towers, AND it affects the power of abilities. Crit does nothing for towers, and most of the items are terrible for stat scaling. They're great for late game against tanks, but that's it.

Please for the love of God listen to yourself >< "we're increasing the AD and lowering the attack speed for on hit builds"

Does't matter, Riot tests and ships things anyway with people screaming against it. You telling us you havn't tested it much means absolutely nothing, as with months of testing Riot will still release busted, broken content.
Any plans on lowering the price?
tbh old BotRK was pretty decent as a concept albeit poorly tuned. AS SOON as Riot changed the item from AD + Lifesteal + Passive to AD + Lifesteal + Attack Speed, BotRK became problematic.

I worry that making BoRK a good first item will just ruin tanks. Tanks are already weak late game after items like BoRK and Lord Dom come in. If it is a first item then the tanks will never even have their strong mid game.

This might be fine for standard lane marksmen build, but this is bad for the unique builds. 
Any Kayle build that considered botrk for optional tank busting will be hurt by this (the AD was just throw away; it’s the % damage and attack speed you want). 

Any on hit jungle build (essentially anyone who builds bloodrazer) would rather just be applying more procs of the bortk proc and bloodrazer proc, and their own on hit proc. Examples are tiger Udyr or on hit Kindred.

I know none of these are “most played” champions or build paths, but they are fun and unique and offer a meaningfully different play pattern.

Riot always says that they want to foster a diversity of play patterns and experiences, but that talk needs to be backed up by having the balance team protect the items that support unique play patterns from multiple champions.
Does this change have anything to do with the new uprising of on-hit kennen builds in Korea?

But on-hit, encompassing all on-hit effects, (distinctly different from on next attack effects) consistently favor attack speed. Basically you're nerfing every on-hit item that would be combined with BotRK. Especially since that active heal/damage is quite strong with not really any compensation.

with current Bork it does 8% of the targets current health, when your fighting big tanky dudes that 45 isn't going to do as much compared to the current passive which (I'm pretty sure) also pairs up with your auto dmg allowing adc to unload dumb amounts of dmg on tanks (but with current armor stacking is cut by around 45% by the time you build Bork). I like to have a build that will zone anything away from me. Without the passive I'll get dived by the fed tank. And with the extra AS you can get atleast 1 extra hit in.

As for early game you don't need that much AD when it's paired with the passive even if the opponent has 500 health it's still doing a considerable amount of dmg when combined with the base AD of champs. For adcs it's a better all around pick than crit which can get stomped by a fed tank and a bad start to the game. But in games in which the tanks aren't fed then crit is better. As for melee champs, only the ones with good AD Scalings benefit , BUT tank shredding won't be nearly as good and to get to the backline often you can't ignore the front line.

Ontop of that the extra 20 AD when put up against damage reduction will only give you a couple more points of dmg vs a tank with atleast 2K health and around (40% dmg reduction a tank with about 600 gold lead) your only gonna deal about around 75 dmg per auto. Assuming you get Bork 1st item at around 15 minutes.

Champ lvl at 15 mins is about 10-15 (if someone could tell me that would be awesome) but even at lvl 15 at 15 mins with Bork as first item for irelia fighting a tank with 40% dmg reduction she will only deal 65 dmg per auto. And she has higher AD per level and base AD than many adcs who on average have a base of 55 AD and 2.4 AD per level. AND they are duo lane so they are atleast a level behind the top laner and mid. Now compare the 8% current health and it's obvious that vs tanks there's a huge difference.
But eh experimentation is a thing
